date.headline: Birth of Max Beckmann on February 12 in Leipzig, Germany.
Studies fine arts in Weimar for three years.
Settles in Berlin, where he remains until 1914.
Exhibits with the Berlin Secession and the German Artists League of Weimar. Marriage to Minna Tube.
Birth of his only son, Peter.
First Beckmann monograph appears, published by Hans Kaiser.
Enlists in German army field medical corps and serves in East Prussia, Flanders and Strasbourg.
Discharged from the army after serious illness. Settles in Frankfurt-am-Main. Separation from Minna.
The second major monograph on Beckmann's work is published.
Appointed professor at the Städelsche Kunstschule, Frankfurt. Divorce from Minna, marries Mathilde von Kaulbach, nicknamed “Quappi”.
First exhibition in New York, held at J. B. Neumann Gallery.
Large retrospective exhibitions held in Mannheim, Basel and Zurich.
Solo exhibitions in Paris and Hanover. Eight paintings are included in German Painting and Sculpture at the Museum of Modern Art, New York.
